title.narrative: Multi-sectoral integrated assistance to conflict-affected displaced and host communities in Rakhin

description.narrative: Affected people have improved access to inclusive protection services.Protective environment is improved by mitigating threats to mental wellbeing, physical and legal safety. Children and women with acute malnutrition access appropriate management services. Timely nutritional assessment and surveillance systems are strengthened and reinforced.

The toll on the psychological well-being and development of conflict affected boys and girls is reduced. Conflict affected boys and girls provided with safe spaces and activities to foster psychological and physical well-being and development. Vulnerable women, girls, unaccompanied and separated children, the elderly and persons with disabilities are enabled to access to services fostering psychological and psychical well-being. IDP and host communities are better equipped to prevent moderate acute malnutrition and severe acute malnutrition in children 6-59 months and in pregnant and lactating women. Communities are capable of identifying moderate acute malnutrition and severe acute malnutrition in children 6-59 months and PLW and their IYCF, hygiene and care practices are improved. PLW and children aged 6 to 59 months at risk of malnutrition are screened regularly and have access to appropriate treatment through timely referrals and supporting services.
